content.question: For time <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the velocity of a particle moving along the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is given by <math alttext="v of t, equals, the cosine of, open parenthesis, 8 times e raised to the negative 0.2, t power, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mi>cos</mi> <mo>⁡</mo> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>8</mn> <msup> <mrow> <mi>e</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>0.2</mn> </mrow> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. The initial position of the particle at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="x equals 2.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the displacement of the particle from time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to time <math alttext="t equals 15" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
